meanings.definition: A rounded projection or division, especially of an organ or gland.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the lobus on the X-ray of the lung.
meanings.sent2: She felt a small lobus on the surface of the peach.
meanings.sent3: The lobus on the tree branch looked like a tiny hill.
meanings.sent4: The lobus of the building jutted out like a small balcony.
meanings.sent5: The lobus on the rock made it look like a miniature mountain.

meanings.sent1: The lobus in the brain controls memory and emotions.
meanings.sent2: The lobus in his brain was responsible for his sense of smell.
meanings.sent3: The lobus in the brain seemed to be the boss of all the other parts.
meanings.sent4: Her lobus of the brain was like a library storing all her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The lobus in the brain was like a control center for all actions.

meanings.definition: A rounded protuberance on the surface of an organ or structure.
meanings.sent1: The lobus on the leaf made it look unique among the others.
meanings.sent2: The lobus on the mushroom gave it an interesting texture.
meanings.sent3: The lobus on the flower petal looked like a small bump.
meanings.sent4: The lobus on the wall stood out like a tiny bump on a smooth surface.
meanings.sent5: The lobus on the fruit felt like a small bump when touched.
